Hi ,

Is there a way by which I can trigger launch of multiple jobs simulta=
neously in Heritrix 3.1.1 ?
thanks=C2=A0


________________________________=

 From: stjiggyfly <kenlow@...>
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com=
 
Sent: Thursday, May 23, 2013 12:51 AM
Subject: [archive-crawler] Mobile U=
ser Agent
 


=C2=A0 
Just as a test I am trying to define my user agent fo=
r Heritrix 1.14.4 and Heritrix 3.1 as a mobile user agent so that it will r=
eceive back mostly just mobile web pages. However, no matter what I seem to=
 try it says that my user-agent is not valid or when it does accept my mobi=
le user agent...it just straight up doesn't work.

I went to see how the go=
oglebot-mobile was doing it and adapted a user agent from it:

Mozilla/5.0 =
(iPhone; U; CPU iPhone OS 4_1 like Mac OS X; en-us) AppleWebKit/532.9 (KHTM=
L, like Gecko Version/4.0.5 Mobile/8B117 Safari/6531 .22.7 (compatible; her=
itrix/1.14.4 +MY_URL_HERE)

Where MY_URL_HERE is set to the URL of the Univ=
ersity where I work.

When it does accept the user agent above it does noth=
ing different. It detects some mobile web pages (which is does regardless),=
 but the way I need it is to crawl mostly just mobile web pages.

Can anyon=
e tell if I am doing something wrong?

      <div=
>Just as a test I am trying to define my user agent for Heritrix 1.14.4 and=
 Heritrix 3.1 as a mobile user agent so that it will receive back mostly ju=
st mobile web pages. However, no matter what I seem to try it says that my =
user-agent is not valid or when it does accept my mobile user agent...it ju=
st straight up doesn't work.<br>
<br>
I went to see how the googlebot-mobil=
e was doing it and adapted a user agent from it:<br>
<br>
Mozilla/5.0 (iPho=
ne; U; CPU iPhone OS 4_1 like Mac OS X; en-us) AppleWebKit/532.9 (KHTML, li=
ke Gecko Version/4.0.5 Mobile/8B117 Safari/6531 .22.7 (compatible; heritrix=
/1.14.4 +MY_URL_HERE)<br>
<br>
Where MY_URL_HERE is set to the URL of the U=
niversity where I work.<br>
<br>
When it does accept the user agent above i=
t does nothing different. It detects some mobile web pages (which is does r=
egardless), but the way I need it is to crawl mostly just mobile web pages.=
<br>
<br>
Can anyone tell if I am doing something wrong?<br>
<br>
